reviews.sentence: Cheap Hotel you get what you pay for. There was a cockroach in our bathroom.
Good price and everything is near by very convinient. very small but I liked the distance. The room was a bit small the bathroom was too small specially the shower and there is NO ELEVATORS.
Great price better location. Simple but comfortable rooms excellent location.

Good hotel on Avalon for the price. The hotel was good considering the age of the building. Clean facilities although bathroom showed signs of wear with wetness and age. Available were warm breakfast drinks in the lobby in the morning and cold water afterwards. Location was excellent. Pegys Gifts and Souvenir just down the streets towards the beach has the best prices for small gift items. Price was right. We would definitely consider returning.
Totally worth it best hotel there hands down for the price. So close to everything super convenient.

Oldie but still Godie. Stairs only to 3rd floor room NO ELEVATOR. Should have a warning. Tiny bathroom badly in need of modernization. Asked to change to 2nd floor which was more renovated. CLEAN quiet cool room. Hotel personnel polite helpful and responded to complaints. Few amenities except coffee water in lobby. Price of room was the most reasonable of all the hotels. Would stay here again because of location.

Nice stay in Catalina. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The lobby area is being remodeled so hotel entrance is around the back. Once we figured out where that was it was fine. No elevator so be prepared for at least 1 flight of stairs to the front desk and possibly another to your room. The room was comfortable and clean but everything could use a fresh coat of paint and new carpet. Rates reasonable for Catalina. 1 block to waterfront so convenient but also a bit of street noise.
Great location great price decent acomodations. Would stay again. Location Price. Bed was comfortable.
A must stay. Best place for the price. Friendliness. The bathroom mirror shells were dirty and rusty. Need to be replaced.

we had a good time. staff is friendly price is within my budget. Noise from street 247 Very difficult to sleep. I was diagnosed by a doctor with exhaustion and that is why I went there to get some rest.
Pleasant. Loved the location and staff was friendly. The bed was awful. Woke up stiff with a back ache both days. Hotel looked dingy old. Price was high for the rooms.
Clean and charming. Kept it is classic 30s charm without feeling old or rundown. Price seemed a little high but that is a problem everywhere now.

Spacious rooms and good beds but the street was noisy. The rooms were very spacious and the quality of the bed was good. The staff was friendly. In our room the windows were absolutely not sound proof there were some gaps through which air was circulating. As a result you could hear the loud music from the sea front that was not too bad as it ended at 10 pm and drunk people screaming in the street that was in the middle of the night for too long. This was on Saturday night the environment was much quieter the following non week end days. Free breakfast was one drink and one item from a nearby bakery I would have liked a broader choice than what was offered. Any extra item was expensive better buy some pastries at the local Vons.

I like the room the bed but I hate the fact they can not grant early check in or early check out. I like the ac and fan they work good. The bed is just fine. I wo nt stay here no more because they can not extend the check in not even the check out no matter what even i am willing to pay extra. no consideration at all.

Great location. The location was great and the staff was very friendly. The staff let us keep our bags at the hotel after we checked out so we did not have to carry them around while waiting for our boat. The hotel is very old and the room was plain. I was disappointed that we paid 400 for the room we got. Granted it was on a Saturday and in the summer season but it was a little high.

Loved my stay will return. Hotel Staff is 1st rate. Very nice. They have a place you can store your bags for FREE. before and after check out. Very nice. You get a card for coffee tea and breakfast. but really it is only for a drink and a 30 biscuit scone next door. Better than nothing. No problems. Will return.
Wonderful. For one night it was very pricey. My friend stayed at another hotel and paid half as less and he stayed in a upper scale hotel. I still liked this hotel I just could not believe the price.
A little expensive for this pretty old hotel. Everything is walking distance. Room is pretty old no view.

Pricey room for size fair customer service great location. The hotel is in a prime location with in walking distance of most everything. Liam one of the hotel staff was awesome. Very friendly and attentive. The room rate was a little expensive for the accommodations. The room is a Bit small. No place to store clothes or luggage in room. The staff needs a little more customer service polishing. One of The maid staff was a bit rude when asked to clean the room. We got back to the room at almost 5 pm and the room was not cleaned. We put the do not disturb sign on the door when we were in the room for a few minutes because we saw the maid staff st a room near ours. I went and asked about cleaning the room and she said you had the sign on the door in a bit of a rude tone. I told her we had been out all day and it 5 pm the room has not been touched and the sign was not on the door until we came back. Rooms facing street get a bit of noise from people walking by and golf carts going by.

Mid level Catalina Hotel. The walls are very thin. You can hear people having conversations in the room next to you. You can also hear every door in the hall slam shut and people walking talking in the halls. The towels are small and poor quality. Our windows also did not close all the way. The windows have blinds but they could really use curtains for how bright it gets in the room. Bathroom is small but adequate. Wifi is unreliable. it is very expensive for the quality you receive but moderately priced for Catalina Island.
